reviewText: A very interesting take on the on-rails shooter genre. What feels initially like the smooth gameplay concept of Star Fox, mixed with the accuracy capabilities of a FPS and the challenge of managing health and damage, is an enjoyable experience. With the ability to jump right in and play, this game requires little learning curve and allows (requires, really) you to jump right into the fray.\n\nIt looks pretty, with graphics that remind me much of Borderlands art style, which is not a detrement at all and fits quite well with the Western layout. And at a cost of $5, this game is a steal. Hopefully the developer continues to develop and releases additional courses, with possibly even a tool to create your own courses and share them online.

reviewText:
Certainly worth the $5.

Pros:
Literal implementation of an 'on-rails' shooter.
Has upgrades and paths similar to an offensive tower-defense game.
Gameplay can be quick, engaging.

Cons:
The voice acting isn't great.
Some cutscenes are not skippable.
Needs better mouse-capture in full screen for multi-monitors.


You can repeat levels/missions for cash to upgrade your train. It would be nice if there were a procedurally generated terrain mode.

reviewText:
This is a game where you shoot stuff, while driving a train along rails. If only there was a name for that sort of thing..

Anyhow, it's pretty much what you'd expect; and that's not a bad thing. In fact, short of the limited nature of the game style itself I really haven't found much wrong with it. Maybe it's a tad too difficult? (But then when a game gets to that stage these days, I generally save my time somewhat by cheating a little.. /cough)

More than once, I was put in mind of the ground levels of Starfox 64. But without the annoying frog-dude. (Slippy is ($) hit!") And that can only be a good thing. On both counts.

Well worth it at the low price
date: and one I'll probably come back to again when I fancy some mindless shooting on railway tracks. (There really should be a name for that.)"
helpfulPercent: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Tumbleweed Express is a pretty fun little game. Worth $5 for sure

Rail shooter, point, click, and kill

Upgrades are nice. You feel noticeable progression as you get them

Only had a couple of bugs happen:
- Once where I was stuck in the train station. Couldn't upgrade my train, start a mission, or view the letters. Had to quit to main menu and restart my game to progress
- On one particular level (Redoubt Pass) if you kill the last generator in the middle before you enter the middle circle, it would lock you in the switch up part. Had to start the level over a few times, because of it

Came across the game via a post on Reddit and decided to try the game that evening. My expectations were low, but this game surprised me and actually enjoyed it quite a bit

reviewText:
Hi, I just played this game and I can't believe it.

People are noting that it's ONLY 7-10 Hours of Gameplay".

Only? The game is $5. The cheapest McDonalds meal you can buy is $5.69. Have you ever eaten a Mc Donald's meal for 7-10 hours? More like 10 minutes. Have you ever played a pinball game for 10 hours with $5? Have you ever done ANYTHING for 10 hours of entertainment for $5? They are basically charging you .50/hr to play this game.

The art style is very

recommended: and MAN the music. The music is absolutely phenomenal

reviewText:
Ever had an interest in Train Simulator but not have $4,000+ to spend on it and all its DLC?

No!?!

Well good cause this is all the train you need for only $5. Hell I think its worth more then that honestly. If you like Rail Shooters, well obviously... this is what you are looking for. Difficulty flows well and each upgrade feels worth it. You can replay levels for more $$$ with a few more challenges and some levels even have more then 1 path to take.

After upgrading to multiple train cars I do wish there was multiplayer where you and your friends each control one Car and battle for survival and scores.

Really great concept and I hope the developer continues to make more awesome games!

reviewText:
https://youtu.be/On9BHB9hSuM

This really is quite the gem of a game, especially for its price ($5.00 with no sale).

The artwork is similar to borderlands and the gameplay is a bit like a tower defense in reverse.  The gameplay mechanics all run very smooth, the upgrade system hits the 'just right' mark where you can replay missions for contracts (essentially challenge missions) to fully upgrade as you do along, or you can stick with the normal upgrade pace.  What you choose to do is up to personal preference.

For  a full review/let's play please see the video above.

For fullscreen and other videos, please visit:  http://www.youtube.com/c/LittleMacscorner

reviewText: its a fun game but its INCREDIBLY short, in the 4 hours ive played it i beat every level with a perfect 3 start rating and finished at least 80-85% of the side missions. gameplay is solid, graphics are decent and ive had none of the video issues i see other reviewers talking about, audio is solid, plot is a sidenote(really not a huge problem), voice acting is hammy but not annoying and even funny at times and its not a long game at all. you basically get 12 levels where you can get a 1-3 star rating based on how fast you complete said level and each of these 12 levels has 5 or 6 missions to complete, most of which you can complete on your first run of the level. for a game with just single player it would be nice to see more levels, i dont care enough to check but it does not seem to me the devs are planning on releasing any more levels so dont buy it with hopes it will be extended. lastly like i said this game is very very short(100% complete in about 5 hours) but it is quite fun and you cant go wrong with a $5 price tag. i can reccomend this game but if your money is tight its best spent on another bargin game because this one wont keep you busy for very long.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Very fun little game. The graphics are very borderlands-esque. It it a neat concept and depending on how far the Dev's wanted to go with it, it could become a pretty big game. I will list some pros and cons

Pros
-Reasonably priced. For only $5 it well worth what you get
-Great graphics, engaging environment.
-Unique gameplay
-Fun, levels aren't too long and they do a good job of mixing things up, and integrating new enemies.
-Story line actually isnt half bad. World is believable in a sort of post apocaliptic meets steam punk-ish world.

Cons
-Short, but again I believe long enough to be worth $5 or more
-Some levels aren't the best, or just have weird quirks that are annoying. Most are good though. Only 2 come to mind
-Voice acting is pretty bad.
-You need to destroy cacti for a few of the challenges, but their spawning is really weird.
-After you unlock all four train cars and get some guns on them, at normal dificulty, the game kind of plays itself. You really only need to pay attention for switching tracks, lowering bridhes, and clearing road blocks. Not much to worry about after a certain point.

I enjoyed it. It would be fun to be able to customize the look of your train, switch which car you are controlling, add more stuff to the engine, etc. There is tons of potential in this game.

To the devs: Cheers! Found you via reddit.

reviewText:
This is actually a really fun game!

It's a railshooter, (no pun intended) and it is a really fun 1 to.
Now i never play railshooters becouse i don't like the whole '' not walking freely '' thing. But this  game is really good!
You can do special objectives to get more money. (like shoot this, or do that within ___ time )

Music is not exactly in my top 10 best OST of games, but that is ok. A few minor bugs. I got stuck when i came to the first boss battle. But it only happened 1/3 times i played that mission so nothing big.

I recomend this game totally, only missing is the sound of a steam train driving. But do not worry, youtube can solve this for us! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jZUXJyDt8ig

Perhaps multiplayer where people can fight each other or defend the same train? Just a idea.

reviewText: Short but enjoyable throughout. The game's not to difficult on it's own but the optional objectives, especially the ones involving specific weapons, can be tricky, especially when trying to three star the mission at the same time. There is an annoying bug on the third mission where you end up getting stuck after the encounter with the boss of that region. Not sure how to get around it, just expect to restart that level a few times. Devs seem to be working on it though. Aside from that I haven't had any major bugs. The game's worth the price.

reviewText:
Very fun and enjoyable game. An interesting new twist on the traditional tower defence.

Pros:

Art style is nice, animations are smooth
Music is catchy
Upgrades and progression is balanced and well done.

Cons:

Voice acting isn't awesome at times, especially with certain characters. The accents seem a tad forced.
Completing certain objectives extremely early seems to break the game sometimes.
Becomes somewhat of a grind towards end-game. Nothing excessive, but there nonetheless.

Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed the game. Hats off to the dev team for the well-polished and enjoyable experience.

reviewText:
This isn't usually my style of game, but I figured I'd give it a try, and I'm glad I did. The train upgrading is fun, missions make each level more interesting, and the style is cool.

On the negative side, I'd say the boss battles are too easy, but I did also make sure to be fully upgraded before each one.

Also wanted to add that the linux support is a big plus. I probably wouldn't have bought the game without it.

reviewText:
It sucks that it's only 12 levels but there is enough reason to play each level multiple times. You'll get about a dollar an hour out of it. Genuinely entertaining.

Cons:
-Voice acting. Can be laughably bad sometimes.
-Story is meh
-Some game breaking bugs. Last boss would disappear mid fight or become invincible. Had to fight last boss 4 times before he would die.
-No way to skip in game cutscenes.
-NO WAY TO SWITCH BETWEEN TURRETS ON CARS BESIDES SELLING AND REBUYING TURRETS. EXTREMELY ANNOYING. PLEASE MAKE AN OPTION TO BUY MORE TURRETS FOR EACH CAR AND SWITCH BETWEEN THEM.
-No way to just turn of turrets for cars besides selling them. They get in the way of a lot of side missions.

Still fun enough to 100%
